metadata.title: Golfing Papa
metadata.performed-by: Mamie Smith and The Jazz Hounds

verse.line: Golfing Dan was a golfing man,
He'd golf from morn till night.
He had a mama, a loving mama.
He'd come home, all tired out,

line.cause: And right to bed he'd go.

line.mental-health: His mama soon got tired of this,

line.action: And these words she whispered low.

verse.line: She says, golfing papa you're way over par,

line.action: You'll have to stop puttin on the green.

line.relationship: You've had your way on the fairway,

verse.line: You know just what I mean.
Now, your stance is perfect, Your aim is true,

line.description: But papa when you drive, You fail to follow through.

line.relationship: Cause when you drive you slice, and go right in the rough.

line.cause: From paying green fees you've got me broke,

verse.line: Your shaft is bent and now you've lost your master stroke.

line.action: So pack your golf bags you've had your fun,

line.mental-health: I found another man who made a hole in one.
